subject: RE: [junit] Query regarding Regarding Mock Objects
msgSnippet: ...  ... Sometimes there are corporate standards to be followed. Sometimes the humble corporate programmers get mandates from above, backed up by
messageBody:
>-----Original Message-----
>From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
>Sent: Thursday, March 18, 2004 9:45 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [junit] Query regarding Regarding Mock Objects

<snip>

>By the way....
>
>> private String usrId = null;
>
>Why on Earth would you abbreviate "userId" to "usrId"?!?! To
>save typing
>ONE CHARACTER?!?! Wow.

Sometimes there are corporate standards to be followed. Sometimes the humble corporate programmers get mandates from above, backed up by promises of "consequences" if any of the shiny new rules are broken. Sad but true. I've worked in some places where it's dangerous to be caught thinking.

assertEquals(myEmployer, "nice people");

>J. B. Rainsberger,

Simon
